cf.DomainAncillary.sum¶

DomainAncillary.sum()[source]¶

The sum of the data array.

See also

collapse, max, mean, mid_range, min, range, sample_size, sd, var

Examples 1: 
>>> d = f.sum()
Returns:
out: cf.Data

The sum of the data array.
Examples 2: 
>>> f.data
<CF Data: [[[236.512756348, ..., 256.93371582]]] K>
>>> f.sum()
27544016.7413
>>> f.sum().data
<CF Data: 27544016.7413 K>
